data.title: Vicksburg District > Missions > Regulatory > Public Notices
data.text:
The Vicksburg District is posting a Special Public Notice seeking comments on the need for regional conditions to help ensure that the adverse environmental effects of activities authorized by the proposed 2020 Nationwide Permits (NWPs) are no more than minimal, individually and cumulatively to the resources in Mississippi. Division engineers are authorized to add regional conditions specific to the needs and/or requirements of a particular region or state. Division engineers may also suspend or revoke specific NWPs in certain geographic areas (e.g., states or watersheds) or high-value aquatic systems where the adverse environmental effects caused by activities authorized by those NWPs may be more than minimal. As the lead Corps district for the State of Mississippi, the Vicksburg District is not proposing to add regional conditions specific to Mississippi.

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby issuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 20, on behalf of the Public. GENERAL PERMIT 20 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities in waters of the United States associated with the construction, maintenance, repair, replacement, and/or removal of utility lines and associated facilities within the regulatory jurisdiction of the Vicksburg District in the states of Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi, and the Memphis District in the states of Arkansas and Mississippi. Typical activities include open-cut trenching and backfilling and horizontal directional drilling for buried utility lines, fill for the construction of pole foundations and substations, compressor stations, pads, handhole covers, outfalls and associated intakes, aerial crossings over navigable waters, and temporary structures, fills, and work necessary to conduct the utility line activity. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 20 is September 28, 2020; the expiration date is September 28, 2025.

Comment Period Opens: 9/21/2020

Comment Period Closes: 10/21/2020

Regulator: Mr. Bryan Williamson

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District

Project Description: The Vicksburg District is posting a Special Public Notice to announce the Clean Water Act Section 401 Certification Rule. Effective September 11, 2020, the “Clean Water Act (CWA) Section 401 Certification Rule” (Rule) is being implemented nationwide. The Rule establishes procedures that promote consistent implementation of CWA Section 401 and regulatory certainty in the federal permitting process. Section 401 of the CWA provides states and authorized tribes with an important tool to help protect the water quality of federally regulated waters within their borders, in collaboration with federal agencies. Section 401 of the CWA requires that, for any federally licensed or permitted project that may result in a discharge into waters of the United States, a water quality certification be issued to ensure that the discharge complies with applicable water quality requirements. The Rule addresses some key areas of the CWA Section 401 certification process, including timelines for review and action, the scope of certification review, and early engagement (pre-filing meetings).

Comment Period Opens: 07/01/2020

Comment Period Closes: 07/31/2020

Regulator: Bryan Williamson and Jerry Bourne

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg and Memphis Districts

Project Description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg and Memphis Districts, are proposing the issuance of a Department of the Army General Permit (General Permit 20) for structures in or affecting waters of the United States and/or discharges of dredged and/or fill material into waters of the United States associated with the construction, maintenance, repair, replacement, and/or removal of utility lines and associated facilities within the regulatory jurisdiction of the Vicksburg District in the states of Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi, and the Memphis District in the states of Arkansas and Mississippi. Typical activities include open-cut trenching and backfilling and horizontal directional drilling for buried utility lines, fill for the construction of pole foundations and substations, compressor stations, pads, handhole covers, outfalls and associated intakes, aerial crossings over navigable waters, and temporary structures, fills, and work necessary to conduct the utility line activity.

Regulator: Bryan Williamson

Applicant: Mr. Scott Urwick, Enable Gulf Run Transmission, LLC, c/o SWCA Environmental Consultants

Project Description: The applicant is applying for a Department of the Army permit to conduct activities within jurisdictional areas for the purpose of installing a new natural gas transmission pipeline and for the modification of other existing pipeline facilities. The applicant will develop the proposed Gulf Run Pipeline originating in Red River Parish, crossing through De Soto, Sabine, Vernon, and Beauregard Parishes, and terminating in Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana. The Pipeline will consist of an approximate 134-mile-long, 42-inch-diameter, natural gas transmission pipeline, and related ancillary facilities, extending from a receipt point with the existing Line CP pipeline, to a delivery point at an interconnect with the existing Golden Pass pipeline near Starks, Louisiana. Approximately 36.31 miles of the proposed Pipeline will be constructed within the Vicksburg District, where the proposed Pipeline crosses portions of Red River, De Soto, and Sabine Parishes. The portion of the project within the Vicksburg District is located in Section 30, T14N- R11W, Latitude 32.167064, Longitude -93.52256, within Watson Bayou-Bayou Pierre watershed part of the Bayou Pierre Drainage Basin (8-digit USGS HUC 11140206), De Soto Parish, Louisiana.

Comment Period Opens: 03/05/2020

Comment Period Closes: 03/26/2020

Regulator: Andy Sanderson

Applicant: Mr. Jerome Benoit, Phylway Construction, LLC

Project Description: The applicant is applying for a Department of the Army permit to discharge dredged and/or fill material into jurisdictional waters of the United States for the construction of a haul road across an existing borrow pit in Warren County, Mississippi. The stated purpose is to provide a stable haul road to facilitate the Public Notice 2 hauling of clay from a borrow area to a U.S. Army Corps of Engineers project involving levee enlargement.

The proposed haul road right-of-way would be approximately 445 feet (ft) long by approximately 100 ft wide. The road through jurisdictional areas would be approximately 445 ft long by 60 ft wide.

The total project site is approximately 1.14 acres in size containing approximately 0.60 acre of jurisdictional wetlands and 0.52 acre of open water. The proposed project would result in the clearing and filling of 0.49 acre of wetlands, fill of 0.46 acre of open water, along with the clearing of 0.11 acre of wetlands. Water connectivity would be maintained within the borrow pit through the installation of an 80 ft long by 36 inch diameter culvert in the haul road. Approximately 10,500 cubic yards of clay fill material would be placed within the wetlands and open water.

Comment Period Opens: 02/14/2020

Comment Period Closes: 02/14/2025

Regulator: Spencer Dixon

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District

Project Description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby issuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 50, on behalf of existing ports, harbors and other navigation stakeholders along the Red River in Louisiana. GENERAL PERMIT 50 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities Associated with Maintenance Dredging for the Removal of Sediment Accumulations within the Main Navigation Channel, Around Existing Docks, Under Existing Barge Fleeting and Mooring Areas, and within Associated Access Channels and Port Basins and the Subsequent Discharge of the Dredged Material along Portions of the Red River Located within the Vicksburg District, Regulatory Branch, Geographic Area of Responsibility in Louisiana. Dredged material may be discharged in an upland contained area (non-jurisdictional area), or discharged as a hydraulic suspension into “swift water” of the main channel of the river. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 50 is February 14; 2020 the expiration date is February 14, 2025. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 50 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 01/11/2019

Comment Period Closes: 02/10/2019

Regulator: Jennifer Brown

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District

Project Description: Project Description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is proposing the reissuance of Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 19, with modifications, for structures or work affecting navigable waters of the United States and discharges of dredged and/or fill material in waters of the United States, which are associated with THE EXPLORATION FOR, AND SUBSEQUENT PRODUCTION OF, HYDROCARBONS located within the Vicksburg District, Regulatory Branch, geographic area of responsibility in Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi. These activities include the construction of related items such as access roads, initial flowlines, mud and reserve pits, and associated levees; the construction of earthen mounds (pads) for the pump, treater, and tank battery; and for the construction of a firewall around the tank battery.

Regulator: Spencer Dixon

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is extending the effective period of Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 16, on behalf of existing commercial and municipal ports and harbors along the Mississippi River. GENERAL PERMIT 16 (available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/) may be used to authorize maintenance dredging for the removal of silt accumulations around existing docks, under existing barge fleeting and mooring areas, and within associated access channels and port basins; and the discharge of the dredged material along portions of the Mississippi River located in the Vicksburg District. The current GENERAL PERMIT 16 expiration date of April 25, 2019 will be extended until October 22, 2019.

Comment Period Opens: 10/02/2019

Comment Period Closes: 10/02/2024

Regulator: Tony Lobred

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the Mississippi Department of Transportation (MDOT)

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 46, on behalf of the Mississippi Department of Transportation (MDOT). GENERAL PERMIT 46 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities associated with the discharge of dredged or fill material in waters of the United States and/or structures or work affecting navigable waters of the United States associated with the construction and stabilization of roadway embankments and bridge abutments within the State of Mississippi. These activities include the repair and stabilization of existing roadway embankments and bridge abutments; the installation of additional traffic lanes to existing roadways; the upgrading of bridges and other stream-crossing structures; and construction along new alignments. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 46 is October 2, 2019; the expiration date is October 2, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 46 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 09/30/2019

Comment Period Closes: 09/30/2024

Regulator: Spencer Dixon

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the General Public

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 25, on behalf of the public. GENERAL PERMIT 25 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities in waters of the united states associated with the CONSTRUCTION OF RECREATIONAL BOATING FACILITIES located within the Vicksburg District, Regulatory Branch, geographic area of responsibility in Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi. These activities include the construction of related items such as boat ramps, parking areas, access roads, fishing piers, docks (both fixed and floating) and associated facilities. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 25 is September 30, 2019; the expiration date is September 30, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 25 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 09/25/2019

Comment Period Closes: 09/252024

Regulator: Spencer Dixon

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the General Public

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 16, on behalf of Existing Commercial and Municipal Ports and Harbors. GENERAL PERMIT 16 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities associated with Maintenance Dredging of Access Channels, Port Basins and Terminal Areas of Commercial and Municipal Ports along the Mississippi River within the Vicksburg District. These activities include maintenance dredging for the removal of silt accumulations around existing docks, under existing barge fleeting and mooring areas, and within associated access channels and port basins; and the discharge of the dredged material. Dredged material may be discharged in an upland contained area (non-jurisdictional area), or discharged as a hydraulic suspension into “swift water” of the main channel of the river. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 16 is September 25, 2019; the expiration date is September 25, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 16 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 09/25/2019

Comment Period Closes: 09/25/2024

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the General Public

Regulator: Jerry Bourne

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 32, on behalf of the Public. GENERAL PERMIT 32 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities in waters of the United States associated with the Construction of Minor Drainage and Water Level Control Structures within the Vicksburg District. Widely used drainage and water control structures include, but are not limited to, cantilever overfall pipes, drop inlet structures, water level control structures, and grade and erosion control structures. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 32 is September 25, 2019; the expiration date is September 25, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 32 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 09/18/2019

Comment Period Closes: 09/18/2024

Regulator: Bryan Williamson

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the General Public

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 60, on behalf of Entergy Arkansas, Incorporated, Hydro Operations. GENERAL PERMIT 60 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities in waters of the united states associated with minor construction activities on Entergy-owned Arkansas Hydropower Lakes (Catherine and Hamilton), within the Vicksburg District. These activities include shoreline stabilization/retaining walls, boat ramps, dredging/excavation, cut-in boat docks, and swim areas. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 60 is September 18, 2019; the expiration date is September 18, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 60 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

The Vicksburg District is posting a Special Public Notice to notify the public of the proposed agreement between the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District and Entergy, Incorporated to transfer funds pursuant to Section 214 of the Water Resources Development Act of 2000, as amended to expedite the evaluation of permits under jurisdiction of the Department of the Army (DA). This Public Notice announces the preliminary intent of the Vicksburg District to accept and expend funds contributed by Entergy to expedite processing of their DA permit applications, subject to a series of limitations. This Public Notice also solicits comments from the general public on the subject of acceptance and expenditure of funds contributed by a public utility company to expedite the evaluation of DA permit applications.

Comment Period Opens: 7/26/2019

Comment Period Closes: 8/25/2019

Regulator: Spencer Dixon and Ms. Jennifer Brown

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is proposing the issuance of Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 50, on behalf of existing ports, harbors and other navigation stakeholders along the Red River in Louisiana. GENERAL PERMIT 50 (available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/) would be used to authorize maintenance dredging for the removal of sediment accumulations within the main navigation channel, around existing docks, under existing barge fleeting and mooring areas, and within associated access channels and port basins and the subsequent discharge of the dredged material along portions of the Red River located within the Vicksburg District, Regulatory Branch, geographic area of responsibility in Louisiana.

Comment Period Opens: 07/1/2019

Comment Period Closes: 06/30/2024

Regulator: Jerry Bourne

USACE, Vicksburg District – Public Notice – General Permit 19

Announcement: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 19, on behalf of the oil and gas industry. GENERAL PERMIT 19 may be used to authorize Regulated Activities in waters of the united states associated with the exploration for and subsequent production of hydrocarbons located within the Vicksburg District, Regulatory Branch, geographic area of responsibility in Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi. These activities include the construction of well drilling pads and related items such as access roads, initial flowlines, mud and reserve pits, and associated levees; the construction of earthen mounds for the pump, treater, and tank battery; and for the construction of a firewall around the tank battery. The effective date for GENERAL PERMIT 19 is July 1, 2019; the expiration date is June 30, 2024. The full text of GENERAL PERMIT 19 is available on the following website: https://www.mvk.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/Permits/Regional-General-Permits/

Comment Period Opens: 3/1/2019

Comment Period Closes: 3/31/2019

Regulators: Bryan Williamson and Spencer Dixon

Applicant: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District

Project Description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is proposing the reissuance of Department of the Army GENERAL PERMIT 16, on behalf of existing ports and harbors along the Mississippi River that would authorize maintenance dredging for the removal of silt accumulations around existing docks, under existing barge fleeting and mooring areas, and within associated access channels and port basins; and the discharge of the dredged material along portions of the Mississippi River located in the Vicksburg District.

CLEAN WATER ACT PROPOSED RULE FOR A REVISED DEFINITION OF THE “WATERS OF THE U.S.”

On February 14, 2019, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the Department of the Army (Army) published for public comment a proposed rule revising the definition of “waters of the United States,” which would establish the scope of federal regulatory authority under the Clean Water Act (CWA). The proposed rule is intended to satisfy the requirements of Executive Order (EO) 13778 that directed the EPA and the Army to review and rescind or replace the 2015 Clean Water Rule (80 FR 37053) and consider interpreting the scope of “waters of the United States” consistent with the Justice Scalia opinion (plurality standard) from Rapanos v. United States (2006). The EO instructed that any new proposed rule shall ensure that the Nation’s navigable waters are kept free from pollution, while at the same time promoting economic growth, minimizing regulatory uncertainty, and showing due regard for the roles of the Congress and the States under the Constitution.

Comment Period Opens: 10/02/2014

Comment Period Closes: 10/022019

Regulator: Anthony R Lobred

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the Mississippi Department of Transportation

Project Description: The Vicksburg District is posting a Public Notice to notify the public of the reissuance of Statewide Regional General Permit 46 (RGP-46) for the construction of roadway embankments and bridge abutments performed by or have oversight from the Mississippi Department of Transportation in waters of the United States within the State of Mississippi.

The Regional General Permit will become effective on 2 October 2014, and will be valid for 5 years. At the end of that time, the cumulative environmental effects of completed work will be reviewed and reissuance of the permit may be considered. However, if unforeseen adverse environmental effects result from the issuance of this General Permit, it may be modified or terminated at any time.

Date: 5/8/2014

Expires: 5/8/2019

Regulator: Amiee Parker

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the General Public for projects conducted or sponsored by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Natural Resources Conservation Service

Project Description: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Vicksburg District, is hereby reissuing of a Department of the Army General Permit for the construction of drainage and/or water level control structures and the associated discharge of dredged and/or fill material into waters of the United States for projects conducted or sponsored by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS), within the regulatory jurisdiction of the Vicksburg District in the States of Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi.

Regulator: Cori Shiers

Applicant: District Engineer, Vicksburg District, on behalf of the Oil and Gas Industry

Project Description: The Vicksburg District is posting a Public Notice to notify the public of the reissuance of Regional General Permit (GP-19) for construction activities in waters of the United States conducted in conjunction with the exploration for and subsequent production of hydrocarbons and for the associated discharge of dredged and fill material within the regulatory jurisdiction of the Vicksburg District in the states of Arkansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi. The General Permit is valid for 5 years. At the end of that time, the cumulative environmental effects of completed work will be reviewed and reissuance of the permit may be considered. However, if unforeseen adverse environmental effects result from the issuance of this General Permit, it may be modified or terminated at any time.
